revised_title: Hybridization and Valence States in Carbon, Nitrogen, and Oxygen Atoms
tldr: This article explores the concept of hybridization and its impact on the valence states of carbon, nitrogen, and oxygen atoms. The authors introduce a classification system for different types of hybridization and develop a method for calculating the term values of hybrid valence states associated with these atoms. The study aims to provide a clearer understanding of the factors governing orbital hybridization and its relevance to molecular structure.
